com.clarionmedia.infinitum.rest

Class RestfulClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clarionmedia.infinitum.rest.RestfulClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RestfulJsonClient, RestfulXmlClient

    public abstract class RestfulClient
extends java.lang.Object

    This abstract class provides an API for communicating with a RESTful web service using objects. Infinitum provides two implementations called RestfulJsonClient, which is used for web services that respond with JSON, and RestfulXmlClient, which is used for web services that respond with XML. These can be extended or re-implemented for specific business needs.

    Version:
    1.0 02/27/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public abstract <T> T load(java.lang.Class<T> type,
         java.io.Serializable id)
                throws InfinitumRuntimeException,
                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an instance of the given persistent model Class as identified by the specified primary key or null if no such entity exists.
        Parameters:
        type - the Class of the persistent instance to load
        id - the primary key value of the persistent instance to load
        Returns:
        the persistent instance
        Throws:
        InfinitumRuntimeException - if the specified Class is marked transient
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid primary key is provided

      • registerDeserializer

        public abstract <T> void registerDeserializer(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                            Deserializer<T> deserializer)
        Registers the given Deserializer for the given Class type. Registering a Deserializer for a Class which already has a Deserializer registered for it will result in the previous Deserializer being overridden.
        Parameters:
        type - the Class to associate this deserializer with
        deserializer - the Deserializer to use when deserializing Objects of the given type

      • prepare

        public final void prepare()
        Prepares this RestfulClient for use. This must be called before using it.

      • save

        public boolean save(java.lang.Object model)
        Makes an HTTP request to the web service to save the given model.
        Parameters:
        model - the model to save
        Returns:
        true if the save succeeded, false if not

      • delete

        public boolean delete(java.lang.Object model)
        Makes an HTTP request to the web service to delete the given model.
        Parameters:
        model - the model to delete
        Returns:
        true if the delete succeeded, false if not

      • saveOrUpdate

        public int saveOrUpdate(java.lang.Object model)
        Makes an HTTP request to the web service to update the given model or save it if it does not exist in the database.
        Parameters:
        model - the model to save or update
        Returns:
        0 if the model was updated, 1 if the model was saved, or -1 if the operation failed

      • registerTypeAdapter

        public <T> void registerTypeAdapter(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                           RestfulTypeAdapter<T> adapter)
        Registers the given RestfulTypeAdapter for the specified Class with this RestfulClient instance. The RestfulTypeAdapter allows a Field of this type to be mapped to a resource field in a web service. Registering a RestfulTypeAdapter for a Class which already has a RestfulTypeAdapter registered for it will result in the previous RestfulTypeAdapter being overridden.
        Parameters:
        type - the Class this RestfulTypeAdapter is for
        adapter - the RestfulTypeAdapter to register

      • getRegisteredTypeAdapters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,? extends TypeAdapter<?>> getRegisteredTypeAdapters()
        Returns a Map containing all TypeAdapter instances registered with this RestfulClient and the Class instances in which they are registered for.
        Returns:
        {@code Map, TypeAdapter>
